metadata.title: CVE-2016-8826 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
All versions of NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in thekernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys for Windows or nvidia.ko for Linux) where auser can cause a GPU interrupt storm, leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcuda1-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-current - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304 - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-304-updates - 304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libcuda1-331 - 340.101-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcuda1-331-updates - 340.101-0ubuntu0.16.04.1

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '304.134-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '340.101-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-375 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '375.39-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
